CatDescriptText: The Allegheny County Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall is located at 4141 Fifth Ave in Oakland.  It was built by architect Henry Hornbostel in 1907, to honor Union Civil War veterans and eventually became a memorial for American veterans of all modern wars.  The pyramidal roof is an allusion to the Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, a tomb for King Mausolus of the Persian Empire ca. 353 B.C.
TitMainTitle: Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall with brick walkway, Fifth Avenue, Oakland
